availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
Monticello Ky Jany 12/64
Gov. Thos E Bramlett
Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir

You perhaps remember that near two years ago when you were encamped at "Camp Green" you kindly offered to recieve from me in Confederate money forty dollars ($40=). and return to me proceeds of same, Will you please advise me in relation same &cc as i have not received any thing therefor,
I also delivered a Barge at said camp landing for which I have received no compensation,
Please advise me how I shall proceed to make collections for same
